name: fbelss
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cfbas, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(c2, c1))

stmt.origin: elpwid(c2, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cfbas, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cfbas, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(c2, c1))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cfbas, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(c2, cpw(c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cfbas, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(c2, c1))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cfbas, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(c2, cpw(c1)))

stmt.origin: sselda(c2, c0, cpw(c1), wcel(c0, cfv(cfbas, c1)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cfbas, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(c2, cpw(c1)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cfbas, c1)), wss(c0, cpw(c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cfbas, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(c2, c1))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cfbas, c1)), wss(c0, cpw(c1)))
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cfbas, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(c2, c1))

comment: An element of the filter base is a subset of the base set. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 28-Jul-2015.)
